poem:
Title: "In Disquiet Harmony: The Struggle and Silence"

Echoes stir in the valley of time,
Men, women, left to clutch their creeds,
Divided, they stand on shifting sands.
Out, beyond the tumultuous divide,
Silent is the songbird's threadbare canticle.
Once full-throated, now lost to the winds.
An anthem of feathered life in retreat,
Burdened by our indifference.  
Mournful, underneath the Southern Cross,
Ideologies spar, while nature counts the cost.
